results.1-1: Black opal (dark green with black mottling and golden flecks)
results.5-5: Opal (pale blue with green and golden mottling)
results.6-6: Star ruby (ruby with white star-shaped center)
results.7-7: Star sapphire (blue sapphire with white star-shaped center)

results.2-2: Banded agate (striped brown, blue, white, or red)
results.4-4: Eye agate (circles of gray, white, brown, blue, or green)
results.6-6: Lapis lazuli (light and dark blue with yellow flecks)
results.8-8: Moss agate (pink or yellow white with mossy gray or green markings)

results.6-6: Jade (light green, deep green, or white)
results.9-9: Spinel (red, red brown, or deep green)
results.10-10: Tourmaline (pale green, blue, brown, or red)

results.1-1: Fine gold chain set with a fire opal
results.3-3: Embroidered silk and velvet mantle set with numerous moonstones
results.4-4: Platinum bracelet set with an emerald
results.5-5: Embroidered glove set with jewel chips
results.8-8: Gold circlet set with four aquamarines
results.9-9: Eye patch decorated with tiny blue sapphires and moonstones
results.10-10: A necklace string of small pink pearls

results.5-5: Black velvet mask stitched with silver thread
results.8-8: Handheld mirror set in a painted wooden frame
results.10-10: Gold locket with a painted portrait inside

results.4-4: Silver necklace with a gemstone pendant
results.7-7: Well-made tapestry that is 10 feet by 10 feet

results.1-1: Black sapphire (lustrous black with glowing highlights)
results.2-2: Diamond (blue white, canary, pink, brown, or blue)

results.8-8: Onyx (bands of black and white, or pure black or white)
results.11-11: Star rose quartz (rosy stone with white star-shaped center)

results.5-5: Gold jewelry box with platinum filigree
results.7-7: Jade game board with gold playing pieces
results.8-8: Bejeweled ivory drinking horn with gold filigree
results.9-9: Gilded royal coach or funeral barge
results.10-10: Ceremonial gold armor with black pearls

results.2-2: Bundle of sheet music representing the lost dirges of a famous composer
results.3-3: Carved wooden harp with ivory inlay and zircon gems
results.5-5: Gold comb shaped like a dragon with red garnets as eyes
results.6-6: Bottle stopper cork embossed with gold leaf and set with amethysts
results.7-7: Detailed, life-sized dragonborn skull cast in electrum
results.9-9: Obsidian statuette with gold fittings and inlay

results.1-1: The adventurers confront a villain and a group of minions in a battle to the finish.
results.2-2: The adventurers chase a villain while dodging obstacles designed to thwart them, leading to a final confrontation in the villain’s refuge.
results.3-3: The actions of the adventurers or a villain result in a cataclysmic event that the adventurers must escape.
results.4-4: The adventurers race to the site where a villain is bringing a master plan to its conclusion, arriving just as that plan is about to be completed.
results.5-5: A villain and two or three lieutenants perform separate rites in a large room. The adventurers must disrupt all the rites.
results.6-6: An ally betrays the adventurers as they’re about to achieve their goal. (Use this climax carefully, and don’t overuse it.)
results.7-7: A portal opens to another plane of existence. Creatures on the other side spill out, forcing the adventurers to close the portal while dealing with a villain at the same time.
results.8-8: The dungeon begins to collapse while a villain attempts to escape in the chaos.
results.9-9: The adventurers must choose whether to pursue a fleeing villain or save an NPC they care about or a group of innocents.
results.10-10: Just when the characters think the main threat is defeated, it transforms into a different monster or a more powerful form.

results.1-1: Introduce a person, an object, or information that the characters need to transport safely to a location involved in the new adventure.
results.2-2: Have a major villain flee to a location that features in the new adventure. The characters might be able to pursue the villain, or they might have to search for clues about where the villain has gone.
results.3-3: Introduce clues suggesting that a villain or another NPC in this adventure is part of a larger group—a group that features prominently in the new adventure.
results.4-4: Introduce a villainous group that’s featured in the new adventure by having its agents spy on or interfere with the characters’ activities.
results.5-5: Have travelers bring news of events transpiring elsewhere, leading characters toward the new adventure.
results.6-6: Give the characters a treasure that’s wrapped in mystery they’ll need to unravel in the new adventure.

results.2-2: The leak in the roof has been fixed.
results.5-5: One of your hirelings adopted a stray dog.
results.6-6: You received a lovely letter from a friend.
results.7-7: Some practical joker has been putting rotten eggs in people’s boots.

results.1-60: Random location on the plane you named
results.61-70: Random location on an Inner Plane determined by rolling [[/r 1d6]]: on a 1 , the Plane of Air; on a 2 , the Plane of Earth; on a 3 , the Plane of Fire; on a 4 , the Plane of Water; on a 5 , the Feywild; on a 6 , the Shadowfell
results.71-80: Random location on an Outer Plane determined by rolling [[/r 1d8]]: on a 1 , Arborea; on a 2 , Arcadia; on a 3 , the Beastlands; on a 4 , Bytopia; on a 5 , Elysium; on a 6 , Mechanus; on a 7 , Mount Celestia; on an 8 , Ysgard
results.81-90: Random location on an Outer Plane determined by rolling [[/r 1d8]]: on a 1 , the Abyss; on a 2 , Acheron; on a 3 , Carceri; on a 4 , Gehenna; on a 5 , Hades; on a 6 , Limbo; on a 7 , the Nine Hells; on an 8 , Pandemonium
results.91-100: Random location on the Astral Plane

results.3-3: Uses an elegant mobility device (wheelchair, brace, or cane)

results.46-49: Ring of Elemental Command (air, earth, fire, or water)

results.22-23: Figurine of Wondrous Power (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpBronzeGrif]{bronze griffon}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpEbonyFlyRa]{ebony fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpGoldenLion]{golden lions}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpIvoryGoats]{ivory goats}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpMarbleElep]{marble elephant}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpOnyxDogRar]{onyx dog}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFwpSerpentine]{serpentine owl})

results.1-1: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgAmuletOfProof]{Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location}

results.27-28: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgManualOfGolem]{Manual of Golems} (clay, flesh, iron, or stone)

results.1-1: [[/r 5d4#Toadstools]] toadstools sprout. If a creature eats a toadstool, roll [[/r 1d2#Toadstool side-effect]]{any die}. On an odd roll, the eater must succeed on a [[/save ability=con dc=15 format=long]] or take [[/damage 5d6 type=poison]] damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned] condition for 1 hour. On an even roll, the eater gains [[/healing 5d6 type=temphp]] for 1 hour.
results.2-10: A geyser erupts and spouts water, beer, mayonnaise, tea, vinegar, wine, or oil (DM’s choice) 30 feet into the air for [[/r 1d4#Geyser duration (minutes)]] minutes.
results.11-20: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.actors.Actor.NB6wUgVqeOQtsQKu]{Treant} sprouts. Roll [[/r 1d2#Treant alignment]]{any die}. On an odd roll, the treant is Chaotic Evil. On an even roll, the treant is Chaotic Good.
results.21-30: An animate but immobile stone statue in your likeness rises and makes verbal threats against you. If you leave it and others come near, it describes you as the most heinous of villains and directs the newcomers to find and attack you. If you are on the same plane of existence as the statue, it knows where you are. The statue becomes inanimate after 24 hours.
results.31-40: A campfire with green flames springs forth and burns for 24 hours or until it is extinguished.
results.51-60: [[/r 1d4 + 4#Bright-pink toads]] bright-pink @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobFrog000000]{toads} crawl forth. Whenever a toad is touched, it transforms into a Large or smaller monster of the DM’s choice that acts in accordance with its alignment and nature. The monster remains for 1 minute, then disappears in a puff of bright-pink smoke.
results.61-70: A hungry @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.actors.Actor.1ES45ODWg3pCrkzv]{Bulette} burrows up and attacks.
results.71-80: A fruit tree grows. It has [[/r 1d10 + 20#Pieces of fruit]] fruit, [[/gmr 1d8#Fruits acting as Potions]] of which act as randomly determined potions. The tree vanishes after 1 hour. Picked fruit remains, retaining any magic for 30 days.
results.81-90: A nest of [[/r 1d4 + 3#Rainbow-colored eggs]] rainbow-colored eggs springs up. Any creature that eats an egg makes a [[/save ability=con dc=20 format=long]]. On a successful save, a creature permanently increases its lowest ability score by 1, randomly choosing among equally low scores. On a failed save, the creature takes [[/damage 10d6 type=force]] damage from an internal explosion.
results.91-95: A pyramid with a 60-foot-square base bursts upward. Inside is a burial chamber containing a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.actors.Actor.t8WYD7ak07X7xpx8]{Mummy} , a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.actors.Actor.UFW8M3JHzHkxUEGM]{Mummy Lord} , or some other Undead of the DM’s choice. Its sarcophagus contains treasure of the DM’s choice.
results.96-100: A giant beanstalk sprouts, growing to a height of the DM’s choice. The top leads where the DM chooses, such as to a great view, a cloud giant’s castle, or another plane of existence.

Candle of Invocation: Outer Plane Destin.name: Candle of Invocation: Outer Plane Destination

Carpet of Flying: Size, Capacity, and Sp.name: Carpet of Flying: Size, Capacity, and Speed

results.1-20: 3 × 5 ft. | 200 lb. capacity | 80 ft. Fly speed
results.21-55: 4 × 6 ft. | 400 lb. capacity | 60 ft. Fly speed
results.56-80: 5 × 7 ft. | 600 lb. capacity | 40 ft. Fly speed
results.81-100: 6 × 9 ft. | 800 lb. capacity | 30 ft. Fly speed

results.1-6: The item communicates by transmitting emotion to the creature carrying or wielding it<.
results.7-9: The item speaks one or more languages.
results.10-10: The item speaks one or more languages. In addition, the item can communicate telepathically with any creature that carries or wields it.

results.1-1: Aberration. The item is ancient. At a glance, it seems to be covered with mucus.
results.2-2: Celestial. The item is half the normal weight and inscribed with feathered wings, suns, and stars. Fiends find it repulsive.
results.3-3: Devotees of Lolth. The item is half the normal weight. It is inscribed with spiders and webs in honor of Lolth.
results.4-4: Dragon. This item incorporates precious metals and gems from a dragon’s hoard. It grows warm when within 120 feet of a Dragon.
results.5-6: Dwarf. The item is durable and has Dwarvish runes worked into its design. It might be associated with a clan that would like to see it returned to their ancestral halls.
results.7-7: Elemental Air. The item is half the normal weight and feels hollow. If it’s made of fabric, it is diaphanous.
results.8-8: Elemental Earth. This item might be crafted from stone. Any cloth or leather elements are studded with finely polished rock.
results.9-9: Elemental Fire. This item is warm to the touch, and any metal parts are crafted from black iron. Flame imagery covers its surface.
results.10-10: Elemental Water. Lustrous fish scales replace leather or cloth on this item, and seashells and worked coral (as hard as any metal) replace metal portions.
results.11-12: Elf. The item is half the normal weight. It is adorned with symbols of nature: leaves, vines, stars, and the like.
results.13-13: Fey. The item is exquisitely crafted from the finest materials and glows with a pale radiance in moonlight, shedding Dim Light in a 5-foot radius. Any metal in the item is silver or mithral rather than iron or steel.
results.14-14: Fiend. The item is made of iron or horn, and any cloth or leather components are crafted from the hide of Fiends. Leering faces or vile runes are engraved on its surface. Celestials find it repulsive.
results.15-15: Giant. The item is larger than normal and was crafted by Giants for use by their smaller allies.
results.16-16: Gnome. The item is crafted to appear ordinary and well used. It could also incorporate gears and mechanical components, even if these aren’t essential to its function.
results.17-19: Human. The item was created during the heyday of a fallen human kingdom, or it is tied to a human of legend. It might hold writing in a forgotten language or symbols whose significance is lost to the ages.
results.20-20: Undead. The item incorporates symbols of death, such as bones and skulls, and it might be crafted from parts of corpses. It feels cold to the touch.

results.2-2: A key figure died; murder is suspected.
results.3-3: War brews between rival guilds or gangs.
results.5-5: Monsters attack anyone who approaches or leaves the settlement.
results.8-8: A prophecy of doom has residents on edge.
results.9-9: Locals are being drafted to fight in a war.

Deck of Illusions.name: Deck of Illusions
Deck of Illusions.description: Stat blocks for these creatures (except the card drawer) appear in the Monster Manual.

results.3-4: Lots of gardens, parks, and greenery
results.5-6: Lots of mud, filth, and litter
results.11-12: Noise and smoke from smithies and forges
results.14-14: Cliffs on one or more sides
results.19-20: Impressive structure (such as a keep, temple, circle of standing stones, or ziggurat)

results.1-1: Perilous. The area is dangerously worn and prone to collapse. Any impacts or damage to the structure, including from spells and other areas of effect, have a 50 percent chance of causing a collapse.
results.2-2: Crumbling. Areas within the dungeon section are choked with rubble and have a 50 percent chance of being &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. &Reference[Half Cover] and hiding places are plentiful.
results.3-3: Neglected. One dungeon hazard—such as brown mold, green slime, or yellow mold (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7]{Hazards})—is abundant.
results.4-4: Abandoned. Most of the dungeon is deserted. Dexterity (Stealth) checks have Disadvantage because any sounds stand out as unusual.
results.5-5: Secure. Ability checks made to break down doors, open locks, or carry out similar activities have Disadvantage.
results.6-6: Thriving. The dungeon is heavily populated. Any loud noises draw the attention of nearby creatures.

results.1-2: Abandoned after internal strife devastated its population
results.3-4: Abandoned because the site was cursed by a god or other powerful entity
results.5-6: Abandoned by its original creators when a plague spread through the dungeon
results.7-9: Amazingly well preserved ancient city inside a dome encased in volcanic ash, submerged underwater, or entombed in desert sands
results.10-12: Built as a fortress guarding a mountain pass
results.13-15: Built as a maze, either to protect treasure from intruders or as a gauntlet where prisoners were hunted by monsters
results.16-18: Built as a stronghold but abandoned after it fell to invaders
results.19-21: Built as a treasure vault to protect powerful magic items and great wealth
results.24-26: Built beneath a city in catacombs or sewers
results.27-29: Built beneath or on top of a mesa or several connected mesas
results.30-32: Built by a religious group to serve as a temple and linked to the energy of other planes of existence
results.33-35: Built by dwarves and decorated with enormous dwarven faces that have been defaced by its current inhabitants
results.39-40: Built in or among the branches of a tree
results.41-43: Built to house a planar portal but abandoned when creatures or energy from the other side of the portal seeped into the dungeon
results.44-46: Carved into a meteorite (before or after it fell to earth)
results.50-52: Caverns carved by a beholder’s disintegration eye ray, with unnaturally smooth walls and vertical shafts connecting different levels
results.53-55: Contains something that led to the downfall of its creators or inhabitants
results.56-58: Dug as a burrow by a monster that might still live inside
results.65-66: Intended as a death trap to eliminate any creature that enters, perhaps to guard a treasure or to harvest souls for a necromantic rite
results.70-72: Long known as the site of a great miracle or another auspicious event
results.73-75: Made by amphibious creatures (such as kuo-toa or aboleths), using water to protect the innermost reaches from air-breathing intruders
results.76-78: Made by a powerful spellcaster (perhaps a lich) as a site for magical research and experimentation
results.79-81: Made by giants at a vast scale
results.82-84: Natural caverns featuring a range of strikingly beautiful rock and crystal formations
results.85-87: On an island in an underground sea
results.88-90: On the back of a Gargantuan creature
results.91-93: Originally constructed as a mine but abandoned when tunnels connected to dangerous Underdark tunnels
results.94-96: Secreted away in a demiplane or in a pocket dimension
results.97-98: Slowly abandoned as its creators died out or migrated away
results.99-100: Transformed by multiple events or disasters over the course of centuries

Efreeti Bottle.name: Efreeti Bottle
Efreeti Bottle.description: The first time the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgEfreetiBottle]{bottle} is opened, the DM rolls on the following table to determine what happens.

results.1-1: The efreeti attacks you. After fighting for 5 rounds, the efreeti disappears, and the bottle loses its magic.
results.2-9: The efreeti understands your languages and obeys your commands for 1 hour, after which it returns to the bottle, and a new stopper contains it. The stopper can’t be removed for 24 hours. The next two times the bottle is opened, the same effect occurs. If the bottle is opened a fourth time, the efreeti escapes and disappears, and the bottle loses its magic.
results.10-10: The efreeti understands your languages and can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} once for you. It disappears when it grants the wish or after 1 hour, and the bottle loses its magic.

results.1-12: Extended journey. Each character in a group traveling together makes a [[/save cha 15]] saving throw. If at least half the group succeeds, travel is delayed by [[/r 1d10]] hours. Otherwise, the journey’s travel time is doubled.
results.20-20: Hurled to a random destination on the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgCosmology0000.JournalEntryPage.lNqkZFfXDs9S3sft]{Astral Plane}

results.5-5: Plane: Elemental Plane of Air. Curtain Color: Pale blue
results.6-6: Plane: Elemental Plane of Earth. Curtain Color: Chestnut
results.7-7: Plane: Elemental Plane of Fire. Curtain Color: Orange
results.8-8: Plane: Elemental Plane of Water. Curtain Color: Green
results.9-9: Plane: Para-elemental Plane of Ash. Curtain Color: Dark gray
results.10-10: Plane: Para-elemental Plane of Ice. Curtain Color: Aquamarine
results.11-11: Plane: Para-elemental Plane of Magma. Curtain Color: Maroon
results.12-12: Plane: Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Curtain Color: Chocolate

results.1-1: The guest is an individual of great renown who stays for 7 days. At the end of their stay, the guest gives you a letter of recommendation (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.XpmEG4yalu71L9ed]{Marks of Prestige}).
results.2-2: The guest requests sanctuary while avoiding persecution for their beliefs or crimes. They depart 7 days later, but not before offering you a gift of [[/award 1d6*100gp]].
results.3-3: The guest is a mercenary, giving you one additional Bastion Defender. The guest doesn’t require a facility to house them, and they stay until you send them away or they’re killed.
results.4-4: The guest is a Friendly monster, such as a brass dragon or a treant. If your Bastion is attacked while this monster is your guest, it defends your Bastion, and you lose no Bastion Defenders. The monster leaves after it defends your Bastion once or when you send it away.

results.1-1: The characters find a letter describing the adventure situation.
results.2-2: The characters are on an unrelated quest, such as searching for a particular magic item, that leads them into the adventure situation.
results.3-3: The adventure situation disrupts a festival or ceremony that the characters are attending.
results.4-4: A magical mishap places the characters in the adventure situation.
results.5-5: While traveling in a caravan or aboard a ship, the characters befriend an NPC who has news about the adventure situation.
results.6-6: The characters are attacked after being mistaken for another group of adventurers. They learn about the adventure situation from a clue left behind by their attackers.

results.1-50: You cast a random spell determined by rolling [[/r 1d10]]: on a 1, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEnlargeRed]{Enlarge/Reduce} (enlarge effect); on a 2, Enlarge/Reduce (reduce effect); on a 3, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}; on a 4, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}; on a 5, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}; on a 6, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (cast on yourself); on a 7, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt}; on an 8, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbPhantasmalFor]{Phantasmal Force}; on a 9, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph}; on a 10, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplStinkingCl]{Stinking Cloud}.
results.51-55: You have the &Reference[Stunned] condition until the end of your next turn, believing something awesome just happened.
results.56-60: A harmless swarm of butterflies fills a 10-foot Cube within 30 feet of yourself. The swarm disperses after 1 minute.
results.61-65: You pull a nonmagical object out of the hat. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the object: on a 1, a vial of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagAcid0000000]{Acid}; on a 2, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagAlchemistsF]{flask of Alchemist’s Fire}; on a 3, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagCrowbar0000]{Crowbar}; on a 4, a lit @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagTorch000000]{Torch}.
results.66-70: You suffer a bout of “magic sickness” and have the &Reference[Poisoned] condition for 1 hour.
results.71-75: You have the &Reference[Petrified] condition until the end of your next turn.
results.76-80: You pull a nonmagical object out of the hat. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the object: on a 1, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Dagger}; on a 2, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagRope0000000]{Rope} with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagGrapplingHo]{Grappling Hook} tied to one end; on a 3, a bag of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagCaltrops000]{Caltrops}; on a 4, a gem worth 50 GP.
results.81-85: A creature appears in an unoccupied space as close to you as possible. The creature isn’t under your control and acts as it normally would, and it disappears after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 Hit Points. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the creature: on a 1, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobCamel00000]{Camel}; on a 2, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobConstricto]{Constrictor Snake}; on a 3, an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobElephant00]{Elephant}; on a 4, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobMule000000]{Mule}.
results.86-90: A Hostile @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.actors.Actor.PcZ0QjIG6bHpffp9]{Swarm of Bats} flies out of the hat, occupies your space, and attacks you.
results.91-95: A vertical, 10-foot-diameter, two-way portal to another plane of existence opens in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you and remains open until the end of your next turn. The DM determines where it leads.
results.96-100: You pull a magic item out of the hat. Roll [[/r 1d6]] to determine the item’s rarity: on a 1–3, Common; on a 4–5, Uncommon; on a 6, Rare. The DM chooses the item, which disappears after 1 hour if it’s not consumed or destroyed before then.

results.1-1: Arcane. This item was created for an ancient order of spellcasters and bears the order’s symbol.
results.2-2: Bane. This item was created to oppose creatures of a particular type, such as Aberrations or Dragons.
results.3-3: Heroic. A great hero once wielded this item. Anyone who knows the item’s history expects great deeds from the new owner.
results.4-4: Ornament. The item honors a special event. Inset gemstones, gold or platinum inlays, and gold or silver filigree adorn its surface.
results.5-5: Prophecy. The item features in a prophecy: its bearer is destined to play a key role in future events.
results.6-6: Religious. This item was used in religious ceremonies dedicated to a particular deity. It has religious symbols worked into it.
results.7-7: Sinister. This item is linked to a deed of great evil, such as a massacre or an assassination. It might have a name or be closely associated with a villain who used it.
results.8-8: Symbol of Power. This item was once used as part of royal regalia or as a badge of high office.

Horn of Valhalla: Type and Requirement.name: Horn of Valhalla: Type and Requirement

results.41-75: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgBrassHornOfVa]{Brass} (3 spirits); Proficiency with all Simple weapons
results.76-90: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgBronzeHornOfV]{Bronze} (4 spirits); Training with all Medium armor
results.91-100: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgIronHornOfVal]{Iron} (5 spirits); Proficiency with all Martial weapons

results.15-15: An Indifferent Giant Ape protects its territory; its primary concern is getting the party to leave.
results.16-16: A Hostile Tyrannosaurus Rex is on the hunt and tries to eat the characters.
results.17-17: Three Allosauruses are hunting in the jungle; they are Hostile and treat the party as prey.
results.18-18: Two Ankylosauruses tromp through the forest nearby. They are territorial and aggressive but Indifferent, and they won’t pursue a fleeing party.
results.19-19: A band of humans, including a Veteran Warrior and eight Infantry Warriors, watch the party. They are Indifferent; they live in the jungle and aren’t used to seeing other people.
results.20-20: Four Minotaurs of Baphomet prowl the jungle looking for Humanoids they can capture and bring back to the temple.

results.49-52: Instrument of the Bards (Canaith mandolin or Cli lyre)

results.56-57: Instrument of the Bards (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgDossLuteInstr]{Doss lute}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgFochlucanBand]{Fochlucan bandore}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMacfuirmidhCi]{Mac-Fuirmidh cittern})

results.1-1: A dragon wyrmling has gathered a band of kobolds to help it amass a hoard.
results.2-2: Wererats living in a city’s sewers plot to take control of the governing council.
results.3-3: Bandit activity signals efforts to revive an evil cult long ago driven from the region.
results.4-4: A pack of gnolls is rampaging dangerously close to local farmlands.
results.5-5: A rivalry between two merchant families escalates from mischief to mayhem.
results.6-6: A new sinkhole has revealed a long-buried dungeon thought to hold treasure.
results.7-7: Miners discovered an underground ruin and were captured by monsters living there.
results.8-8: An innocent person is being framed for the crimes of a shape-shifting monster.
results.9-9: Ghouls are venturing out of the catacombs at night.
results.10-10: A notorious criminal hides from the law in an old ruin or abandoned mine.
results.11-11: A contagion in a forest is causing spiders to grow massive and become aggressive.
results.12-12: To take revenge against a village for an imagined slight, a necromancer has been animating the corpses in the village cemetery.
results.13-13: An evil cult is spreading in a village. Those who oppose the cult are marked for sacrifice.
results.14-14: An abandoned house on the edge of town is haunted by Undead because of a cursed item in the house.
results.15-15: Creatures from the Feywild enter the world and cause mischief and misfortune among villagers and their livestock.
results.16-16: A hag’s curse is making animals unusually aggressive.
results.17-17: Bullies have appointed themselves the village militia and are extorting money and food from villagers.
results.18-18: After a local fisher pulls a grotesque statue from the sea, aquatic monsters start attacking the waterfront at night.
results.19-19: The ruins on the hill near the village lie under a curse, so people don’t go there—except a scholar who wants to study the ruins.
results.20-20: A new captain has taken charge of a band of pirates or bandits and started raiding more frequently.

results.1-1: A portal to the Abyss opens in a cursed location and spews demons into the world.
results.2-2: A band of hunting giants has driven its prey—enormous beasts—into pastureland.
results.3-3: An adult dragon’s lair is transforming an expanse into an environment inhospitable to the other creatures living there.
results.4-4: A long-lost journal describes an incredible journey to a hidden subterranean realm full of magical wonders.
results.5-5: Cultists hope to persuade a dragon to undergo the rite that will transform it into a dracolich.
results.6-6: The ruler of the realm is sending an emissary to a hostile neighbor to negotiate a truce, and the emissary needs protection.
results.7-7: A castle or city has been drawn into another plane of existence.
results.8-8: A storm tears across the land, with a mysterious flying citadel in the eye of the storm.
results.9-9: Two parts of a magic item are in the hands of bitter enemies; the third piece is lost.
results.10-10: Evil cultists gather from around the world to summon a monstrous god or alien entity.
results.11-11: A tyrannical ruler outlaws the use of magic without official sanction. A secret society of spellcasters seeks to oust the tyrant.
results.12-12: During a drought, low water levels in a lake reveal previously unknown ancient ruins that contain a powerful evil.

results.1-1: An ancient dragon is scheming to destroy a god and take the god’s place in the pantheon. The dragon’s minions are searching for Artifacts that can summon and weaken this god.
results.2-2: A band of giants drove away a metallic dragon and took over the dragon’s lair, and the dragon wants to reclaim the lair.
results.3-3: An ancient hero returns from the dead to prepare the world for the return of an equally ancient monster.
results.4-4: An ancient Artifact has the power to defeat or imprison a rampaging titan.
results.5-5: A god of agriculture is angry, causing rivers to dry up and crops to wither.
results.6-6: An Artifact belonging to a god falls into mortal hands.
results.7-7: A titan imprisoned in the Underdark begins to break free, causing terrible earthquakes that are only a hint of the destruction that the titan will cause if it is released.
results.8-8: A lich tries to exterminate any spellcasters that approach the lich’s level of power.
results.9-9: A holy temple was built around a portal leading to one of the Lower Planes to prevent any evil from passing through in either direction. Now the temple has come under siege from both directions.
results.10-10: Five ancient metallic dragons lair in the Pillars of Creation. If all these dragons are killed, the world will collapse into chaos. One has just been slain.

results.1-1: A group of cultists has summoned a demon to wreak havoc in the city.
results.2-2: A rebel lures monsters to the cause with the promise of looting the king’s treasury.
results.3-3: An evil Artifact has transformed a forest into a dismal swamp full of horrific monsters.
results.4-4: An Aberration living in the Underdark sends minions to capture people from the surface to turn those people into new minions.
results.5-5: A monster (perhaps a devil, slaad, or hag) is impersonating a prominent noble to throw the realm into civil war.
results.6-6: A master thief plans to steal royal regalia.
results.7-7: A golem intended to serve as a protector has gone berserk and captured its creator.
results.8-8: A conspiracy of spies, assassins, and necromancers schemes to overthrow a ruler.
results.9-9: After establishing a lair, a young dragon is trying to earn the fear and respect of other creatures living nearby.
results.10-10: The approach of a lone giant alarms the people of a town, but the giant is simply looking for a place to live in peace.
results.11-11: An enormous monster on display in a menagerie breaks free and goes on a rampage.
results.12-12: A coven of hags steals cherished memories from travelers.
results.13-13: A villain seeks powerful magic in an ancient ruin, hoping to use it to conquer the region.
results.14-14: A scheming aristocrat hosts a masquerade ball, which many guests see as an opportunity to advance their own agendas. At least one shape-shifting monster also attends.
results.15-15: A ship carrying a valuable treasure or an evil Artifact sinks in a storm or monster attack.
results.16-16: A natural disaster was actually caused by magic gone awry or a cult’s villainous plans.
results.17-17: A secretive cult uses spies to heighten tensions between two rival nations, hoping to provoke a war that will weaken both.
results.18-18: Rebels or forces of an enemy nation have kidnapped an important noble.
results.19-19: The descendants of a displaced people want to reclaim their ancestral city, which is now inhabited by monsters.
results.20-20: A renowned group of adventurers never returned from an expedition to a famous ruin.

results.1-1: Respected, fair, and just leader or council

results.1-20: While attuned to the Artifact, one of your ability scores (DM’s choice) increases by 2, to a maximum of 24.
results.21-30: While attuned to the Artifact, you regain 1d6 Hit Points at the start of each of your turns if you have at least 1 Hit Point.
results.31-40: When you hit with an attack roll while attuned to the Artifact, the target takes an extra 1d6 Force damage.
results.41-50: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, your Speed increases by 10 feet.
results.51-60: While attuned to the Artifact, you can cast one level 4 spell (chosen by the DM) from it. After you cast the spell, roll 1d6. On a roll of 1–5, you can’t cast it again in this way until the next dawn.
results.61-70: As 51–60 above, except the spell is level 5.
results.71-80: As 51–60 above, except the spell is level 6.
results.81-90: As 51–60 above, except the spell is level 7.
results.91-100: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Immunity to the Blinded, Deafened, Petrified, and Stunned conditions.

results.1-9: You can’t attune to other magic items while you’re attuned to the Artifact. When you become attuned to the Artifact, your Attunement to other magic items ends immediately.
results.10-18: When you become attuned to the Artifact, a random one of your ability scores is reduced by 2, to a minimum of 3. A Greater Restoration spell restores the ability.
results.19-27: When you become attuned to the Artifact, you take 8d10 Psychic damage.
results.28-36: The first time you become attuned to the Artifact, it gives you a quest determined by the DM. You can’t use any of the Artifact’s properties until you complete the quest.
results.37-45: Each time you become attuned to the Artifact, there is a 10 percent chance that you attract the attention of a god who sends an avatar to wrest the Artifact from you. The avatar has the same alignment as its creator and uses the Empyrean stat block. Once it obtains the Artifact, the avatar vanishes.
results.46-54: Each time you become attuned to the Artifact, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die from the shock. If you die, you’re instantly transformed into a Wight under the DM’s control that must protect the Artifact.
results.55-63: The Artifact dilutes potions within 10 feet of itself, rendering them nonmagical.
results.64-72: The Artifact erases scrolls within 10 feet of itself, rendering them nonmagical.
results.73-81: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, creatures of a particular type other than Humanoid (chosen by the DM) are always Hostile toward you.
results.82-90: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Vulnerability to all damage.
results.91-96: The Artifact imprisons a Death Slaad. Each time you become attuned to the Artifact, the slaad has a 10 percent chance of escaping, whereupon it appears in an unoccupied space as close to you as possible and attacks you.
results.97-100: While attuned to the Artifact, you can’t spend Hit Point Dice or regain Hit Points.

Manual of Golems: Type, Time, and Cost.name: Manual of Golems: Type, Time, and Cost

results.4-4: A patch of yellow mold (see Hazards in chapter 3) on a miner’s remains

results.1-20: While attuned to the Artifact, you gain proficiency in one skill of the DM’s choice.
results.21-30: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Immunity to the Poisoned condition.
results.31-40: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions.
results.41-50: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Resistance to one damage type of the DM’s choice.
results.51-60: While attuned to the Artifact, you can cast one cantrip (chosen by the DM) from it.
results.61-70: While attuned to the Artifact, you can cast one level 1 spell (chosen by the DM) from it. After you cast the spell, roll 1d6. On a roll of 1–5, you can’t cast it again in this way until the next dawn.
results.71-80: As 61–70 above, except the spell is level 2.
results.81-90: As 61–70 above, except the spell is level 3.
results.91-100: While attuned to the Artifact, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

results.1-8: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Disadvantage on any ability check or saving throw that uses Strength or Constitution.
results.9-16: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.
results.17-24: While attuned to the Artifact, you have Vulnerability to Poison damage.
results.25-32: While attuned to the Artifact, you have the Blinded condition when you’re more than 10 feet away from it.
results.33-40: While attuned to the Artifact, you have the Deafened condition when you’re more than 10 feet away from it.
results.41-48: While attuned to the Artifact, you lose all sense of smell.
results.49-66: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, your appearance changes as the DM decides.
results.67-72: While attuned to the Artifact, you emit a sour stench noticeable from up to 10 feet away.
results.73-76: Whenever you touch a nonmagical gem or an art object while attuned to this Artifact, the value of the gem or art object is reduced by half. This affects a particular object only once.
results.77-80: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, all Holy Water within 10 feet of you is destroyed.
results.81-84: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, nonmagical flames are extinguished within 30 feet of you.
results.85-88: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, other creatures can’t take Short or Long Rests while within 300 feet of you.
results.89-92: While attuned to the Artifact, you kill any nonmagical vegetation you touch that isn’t a creature.
results.93-100: While you’re attuned to the Artifact, Beasts within 30 feet of you that have a Challenge Rating of 6 or lower are Hostile toward you.

results.1-2: Beacon. You can take a Bonus Action to cause the item to shed Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet, or to extinguish the light.
results.3-3: Compass. You can take a Magic action to learn which way is magnetic north. Nothing happens if this property is used in a location that has no magnetic north.
results.4-4: Delver. While underground, you always know the item’s depth below the surface and the direction to the nearest staircase, ramp, or other path leading upward.
results.5-6: Guardian. The item warns you, granting a +2 bonus to your Initiative rolls if you don’t have the Incapacitated condition.
results.7-8: Harmonious. Attuning to this item takes only 1 minute.
results.9-9: Key. The item is used to unlock a container, chamber, vault, or door.
results.10-10: Secret Message. A message is hidden somewhere on the item. It might be visible only at a certain time, under the light of one phase of the moon, or in a specific location.
results.11-12: Sentinel. The DM chooses a kind of creature, such as mind flayers or trolls. This item glows faintly when such creatures are within 120 feet of it.
results.13-13: Songcraft. Whenever this item is struck or is used to strike a foe, you hear a fragment of an ancient song.
results.14-15: Strange Material. The item was created from a material that is bizarre given its purpose. Its durability is unaffected.
results.16-16: Temperate. You are unharmed by temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower, and 100 degrees Fahrenheit or higher.
results.17-17: Unbreakable. The item can’t be broken. Special means must be used to destroy it.
results.18-18: War Leader. You can take a Magic action to cause your voice or signal to carry clearly for up to 600 feet until the end of your next turn.
results.19-19: Waterborne. This item floats on water and other liquids. You have Advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to swim.

results.3-3: Boastful; makes a show of bravery but runs from danger

results.1-1: Two monsters have a bitter rivalry; each wants the other to suffer.
results.2-2: One monster, bullied by the others, hangs back and flees at the first opportunity.
results.3-3: One monster is revered or even worshiped by the others, who will die for it.
results.4-4: One monster is admired by the group; its allies try to impress or help it.
results.5-5: One monster cares only for itself and not the rest of the group.
results.6-6: One monster bullies the others; it forces them into danger, but they want it defeated.

results.1-60:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.o2IcKz2aAooQr7EK]
Increase the weapon’s bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls by 1, to a maximum of +3. Reroll if the Moonblade already has a +3 bonus.
results.61-75:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.vwQstbhAl6CdxUeN]
When you hit with an attack roll using the Moonblade , you deal an extra 1d6 Force damage. Each time the weapon gains this property after the first, the extra damage increases by 1d6, to a maximum of 3d6. Reroll if the Moonblade already deals an extra 3d6 Force damage on a hit.
results.76-80:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.2lApMhxs1SMQFEqE]
The Moonblade gains the Thrown property with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. Each time you throw the weapon, it flies back to your hand after the attack.
results.81-85:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.VC3o2KY4btBnaIAc]
The Moonblade scores a &Reference[CriticalHits]{Critical Hit} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
results.86-95:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.rzsbnjT5QiK2Jq8E]
You can take a Bonus Action to cause the Moonblade to flash brightly. Each other creature that is within 30 feet of you and not behind Total Cover must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Blinded condition for 1 minute. A creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. You can’t use this property again until you finish a Short or Long Rest.
results.96-99:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.vZ0T3fFRBE3NHG6o]
The Moonblade has the properties of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgRingOfSpellSt]{Ring of Spell Storing}.
results.100-100:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgMoonblade0000.ActiveEffect.Qzkx9WVqILq2hG5c]
You can take a Magic action to conjure a spectral entity that resembles a shadowy elf if you don’t already have one serving you. The entity appears in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of you. It uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.actors.Actor.QGcQYZbVl4bWzi4E]{Shadow} stat block with these changes: it is a Fey, has a Neutral alignment, and doesn’t create new shadows. You control this entity, deciding how it acts and moves. It remains until it drops to 0 Hit Points or you dismiss it as a Magic action.

results.1-1: The NPC is in disguise, concealing their identity or some aspect of their appearance.
results.2-2: The NPC is currently planning, executing, or covering up a crime.
results.3-3: The NPC (or their family) has been threatened with harm unless the NPC does something.
results.4-4: The NPC is under a magical compulsion (perhaps a Geas spell or some kind of curse) to behave in a certain way.
results.5-5: The NPC is seriously ill or in terrible pain.
results.6-6: The NPC feels responsible for someone’s death or ill fortune.
results.7-7: The NPC is on the brink of financial ruin.
results.8-8: The NPC is desperately lonely or harboring an unrequited passion.
results.10-10: The NPC is deeply dissatisfied or unhappy.

results.1-1: A town crier announces that someone is hoping to hire adventurers.
results.2-2: Someone the characters want to impress or need a favor from asks them to deal with the adventure situation.
results.3-3: When the characters arrive in a new city, they find a job board where someone has posted in search of adventurers.
results.4-4: A wealthy patron who is aware of the adventurers’ accomplishments writes to them, offering to pay them for their talents.
results.5-5: A citizen in need, who has learned of the adventurers’ accomplishments and kindness, travels miles to find them and implore them for help.
results.6-6: The adventurers are arrested (on valid or invented charges) and offered a chance to escape punishment by completing a quest.

results.1-1: When magic fails to revive a dead person, the only solution is to venture to the Outer Planes to find the person’s spirit and either release it from some prison or convince the person to return to life.
results.2-2: People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
results.3-3: A long-dead oracle is the only one who knows how a terrible prophecy might be averted, but the cataclysmic fulfillment of the prophecy has already begun.
results.4-4: A god has stopped answering prayers and won’t respond to any Commune spell.
results.5-5: A devil has tricked an angel into meddling in the Blood War, and the angel seeks mortal aid.
results.6-6: A ancestor of one of the characters must be convinced to bless the character before the full power of the character’s bloodline can be unleashed.
results.7-7: A foolhardy knight carried a holy weapon on a doomed mission into the Nine Hells, and the powers of Mount Celestia want the weapon and the knight’s remains retrieved.
results.8-8: A titan is imprisoned on an Outer Plane. The characters might be trying to stop those who seek to release it, or they might want to release it to help defend the world from a greater threat.
results.9-9: To prove themselves worthy of an even greater quest, the characters are sent to slay a horrible monster, win the favor of a powerful planar being, negotiate peace between two warring planar factions, or retrieve a long-lost item on another plane.
results.10-10: An item of legend is being sold at auction in Sigil, the City of Brass, or some other planar metropolis.

results.1-1: Both potions lose their effects, and the mixture creates a magical explosion in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area takes [[/damage 4d10 type=force]] damage.
results.2-8: Both potions lose their effects, and the mixture becomes an ingested poison of your choice (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.UfAEdm3LbTzvQHC5]{Poison}).
results.26-35: Both potions work, but with their numerical effects and durations halved. If a potion has no numerical effect and no duration, it instead loses its effect.
results.91-99: Both potions work, but the numerical effects and duration of one potion are doubled. If neither potion has anything to double in this way, they work normally.
results.100-100: Only one potion works, but its effects are permanent. Choose the simplest effect to make permanent or the one that seems the most fun. For example, a Potion of Healing might increase the drinker’s Hit Point maximum by [[/roll 2d4 + 2]], or a Potion of Invisibility might give the drinker the Invisible condition indefinitely. At your discretion, a Dispel Magic spell or similar magic might end this lasting effect.

results.9-12: Blown astray; add 3d10 days to travel time
results.13-16: Lost; at the end of the travel time, the characters arrive at a location other than the intended destination
results.17-20: Sent through a random color pool (roll on the Astral Color Pools table)

results.1-8: You have the &Reference[Stunned] condition for 1 minute; you repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on yourself on a success.
results.18-20: You have the &Reference[Unconscious] condition for [[/r 1d10]] hours; the effect on you ends if you take damage or if another creature takes an action to shake you awake.

results.1-1: Blissful. You feel fortunate and optimistic about what the future holds. Butterflies and other harmless creatures might frolic in the item’s presence.
results.2-2: Confident. The item helps you feel self-assured.
results.3-3: Covetous. You become obsessed with material wealth.
results.4-4: Fragile. The item crumbles, frays, chips, or cracks slightly when wielded, worn, or activated. This quirk has no effect on its properties.
results.5-5: Loud. The item makes a loud noise—such as a clang, a shout, or a resonating gong—when used.
results.6-6: Metamorphic. The item periodically alters its appearance in slight ways. You have no control over these minor alterations, which have no effect on the item’s use.
results.7-7: Painful. You experience a harmless flash of pain when using the item.
results.8-8: Repulsive. You feel a sense of distaste when in contact with the item and continue to experience discomfort while bearing it.

Ring of Resistance: Damage Type and Gems.name: Ring of Resistance: Damage Type and Gemstone

results.9-15: Silver coffer (1 foot long, 6 inches wide and deep) worth 500 GP
results.16-22: Iron door (up to 10 feet wide and 10 feet high, barred on one side of your choice), which you can place in an opening you can reach; it conforms to fit the opening, attaching and hinging itself
results.52-59: Open pit (a 10-foot Cube), which you can place on the ground within 10 feet of yourself
results.76-83: Spell Scroll containing one spell of level 1, 2, or 3 (your choice)
results.91-96: Window (2 feet by 4 feet, up to 2 feet deep), which you can place on a vertical surface you can reach

results.76-90: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgScrollOfTitan.ActiveEffect.iGenMHTf7Uuy0sQ1]{Kraken} (a kraken requires a body of water large enough to contain it, or the summoning fails and the scroll is wasted)

results.1-1: Hearing and standard vision out to 30 feet
results.2-2: Hearing and standard vision out to 60 feet
results.3-3: Hearing and standard vision out to 120 feet
results.4-4: Hearing and Darkvision out to 120 feet

results.1-3: Apathy. The character has Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws and Initiative rolls.
results.4-5: Dread. The character has Disadvantage on all saving throws.
results.6-6: Delusion. The character has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

results.1-1: Aligned. The item seeks to defeat or destroy those of a diametrically opposed alignment. Such an item is never Neutral.
results.2-2: Bane. The item seeks to thwart or destroy creatures of a particular type, such as Constructs, Fiends, or Undead.
results.3-3: Creator Seeker. The item seeks its creator and wants to understand why it was created.
results.4-4: Destiny Seeker. The item believes it and its bearer have key roles to play in future events.
results.5-5: Destroyer. The item craves destruction and goads its user to fight arbitrarily.
results.6-6: Glory Seeker. The item seeks renown as the greatest magic item in the world by winning fame or notoriety for its user.
results.7-7: Lore Seeker. The item craves knowledge or is determined to solve a mystery, learn a secret, or unravel a cryptic prophecy.
results.8-8: Protector. The item seeks to defend a particular kind of creature, such as elves or werewolves.
results.9-9: Soulmate Seeker. The item seeks another sentient magic item, perhaps one that is similar to itself.
results.10-10: Templar. The item seeks to defend the servants and interests of a particular deity.

results.51-85: The sphere moves through the portal or into the extradimensional space.
results.86-100: A spatial rift sends the sphere and each creature and object within 180 feet of the sphere to a random plane of existence.

results.1-1: The characters all have a vivid dream that foreshadows elements of the adventure.
results.2-2: While preparing spells, one character receives a quest from a god or patron.
results.3-3: A fortune teller’s reading for one of the characters points to a quest and offers hints about challenges that lie ahead.
results.4-4: Flames, clouds, smoke, or huge flocks of birds take distinct shapes that portend the adventure situation.
results.5-5: Animals or animated objects speak clearly to direct the adventurers toward the situation.
results.6-6: Someone who died returns as a ghost and haunts the characters. The ghost prompts the characters to investigate the cause of the ghost’s death and put it to rest.

results.76-90: Roll on a Common Magic Items table of your choice (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgArcanaCommon0]{Arcana}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgArmamentsComm]{Armaments}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgImplementsCom]{Implements}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgRelicsCommon0]{Relics}).
results.91-98: Roll on an Uncommon Magic Items table of your choice (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgArcanaUncommo]{Arcana}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgArmamentsUnco]{Armaments}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgImplementsUnc]{Implements}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgRelicsUncommo]{Relics}).
results.99-100: Roll on a Rare Magic Items table of your choice (@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgArcanaRare000]{Arcana}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgArmamentsRare]{Armaments}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgImplementsRar]{Implements}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.tables.RollTable.dmgRelicsRare000]{Relics}).

results.1-1: A cart or another large obstacle blocks your way. Make a [[/save dex dc=10]] saving throw to get past the obstacle. On a failed save, the obstacle counts as 10 feet of &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.
results.2-2: A crowd blocks your way. Make a [[/save str dc=10]], [[/save dex dc=10]], or [[/save cha dc=10]] saving throw (your choice) to navigate through the crowd. On a failed save, the crowd counts as 10 feet of &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.
results.3-3: A maze of barrels, crates, or similar obstacles stands in your way. Make a [[/save dex dc=10]] or [[/save int dc=10]] saving throw (your choice) to navigate the maze. On a failed save, the maze counts as 10 feet of &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.
results.4-4: The ground is slippery with rain, spilled oil, or some other liquid. Make a [[/save dex dc=10]] saving throw. On a failed save, you have the &Reference[Prone] condition.
results.5-5: You encounter a brawl in progress. Make a [[/save str dc=15]], [[/save dex dc=15]], or [[/save cha dc=15]] saving throw (your choice) to get past the brawlers unimpeded. On a failed save, you take [[/damage 2d4 type=bludgeoning]] damage, and the brawlers count as 10 feet of &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.
results.6-6: You must make a sharp turn to avoid colliding with something impassable. Make a [[/save dex dc=10]] saving throw to navigate the turn. On a failed save, you collide with something hard and take [[/damage 1d4 type=bludgeoning]] damage.

Wand of Wonder Effects.name: Wand of Wonder Effects
Wand of Wonder Effects.description: A roll table of effects for the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.equipment.Item.dmgWandOfWonder0]{Wand of Wonder} which implements the effects as activities where possible.

results.1-20: You cast a spell originating from the chosen point. Roll 1d10 to determine the spell: on a 1–2, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}; on a 3–4, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}; on a 5–6, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball}; on a 7–8, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSlow000000]{Slow}; on a 9–10, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplStinkingCl]{Stinking Cloud}.
results.21-25: Nothing happens at the chosen point of origin. Instead, you have the &Reference[Stunned] condition until the start of your next turn, believing something awesome just happened.
results.26-30: You cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}. The Line created by the spell extends from you to the chosen point of origin.
results.31-35: Nothing happens at the chosen point of origin. Instead, you take [[/damage 1d6 type=psychic]] damage.
results.36-40: Heavy rain falls for 1 minute in a 120-foot-high, 60-foot-radius Cylinder centered on the chosen point of origin. During that time, the area of effect is &Reference[Lightly Obscured].
results.41-45: A cloud of 600 oversized butterflies fills a 60-foot-high, 30-foot-radius Cylinder centered on the chosen point of origin. The butterflies remain for 10 minutes, during which time the area of effect is &Reference[Heavily Obscured].
results.46-50: You cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt}. The Line created by the spell extends from you to the chosen point of origin.
results.51-55: The creature closest to the chosen point of origin is enlarged as if you had cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEnlargeRed]{Enlarge/Reduce} on it. If the target isn’t you and can’t be affected by that spell, you become the target instead.
results.56-60: A magically formed creature appears in an unoccupied space as close to the chosen point of origin as possible. The creature isn’t under your control, acts as it normally would, and disappears after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 Hit Points. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine which creature appears. On a 1, a Rhinoceros appears; on a 2, an Elephant appears; and on a 3–4, a Rat appears.
results.61-64: Grass covers a 60-foot-radius circle of ground, with the center of that circle as close to the chosen point of origin as possible. Grass that’s already there grows to ten times its normal size and remains overgrown for 1 minute.
results.65-68: An object of the DM’s choice disappears into the Ethereal Plane. The object must be neither worn nor carried, within 120 feet of the chosen point of origin, and no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. If there are no such objects in range, nothing happens.
results.69-72: Nothing happens at the chosen point of origin. Instead, you shrink as if you had cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEnlargeRed]{Enlarge/Reduce} on yourself and remain in that state for 1 minute.
results.73-77: Leaves grow from the creature nearest to the chosen point of origin. Unless they are picked off, the leaves turn brown and fall off after 24 hours.
results.78-82: Nothing happens at the chosen point of origin. Instead, a burst of colorful, shimmering light extends from you in a 30-foot Emanation. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con 15]] saving throw or have the &Reference[Blinded] condition for 1 minute. A creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
results.83-87: Nothing happens at the chosen point of origin. Instead, you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on yourself.
results.88-92: Nothing happens at the chosen point of origin. Instead, a stream of [[/r 1d4*10 #Gems]] gems, each worth 1 GP, shoots from the wand’s tip in a Line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide toward the chosen point of origin. Each gem deals [[/damage 1 type=bludgeoning]] damage, and the total damage of the gems is divided equally among all creatures in the Line.
results.93-97: You cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph}, targeting the creature closest to the chosen point of origin. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the target’s new form. On a 1, the new form is a Black Bear; on a 2, the new form is a Giant Wasp; on a 3–4, the new form is a Frog.
results.98-100: The creature closest to the chosen point of origin makes a [[/save con 15]] saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the &Reference[Restrained] condition and begins to turn to stone. While Restrained in this way, the creature repeats the save at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends. On a failed save, the creature has the &Reference[Petrified] condition instead of the Restrained condition. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spell or similar magic.

results.13-17: Wind: Light. Precipitation: Light rain or light snowfall.
results.18-20: Wind: Strong. Precipitation: Heavy rain or heavy snowfall.

results.1-1: You pass through a Swarm of Insects (see the Monster Manual, with the DM choosing whichever kind of insects makes the most sense). The swarm uses one of its actions, targeting you.
results.2-2: A stream or ravine blocks your path. Make a [[/save str dc=10]] or [[/save dex dc=10]] saving throw (your choice) to cross the impediment. On a failed save, the impediment counts as 10 feet of &Reference[Difficult Terrain] for you.
results.3-3: Make a [[/save con dc=10]] saving throw. On a failed save, blowing sand, dirt, ash, snow, or pollen causes you to have the &Reference[Blinded] condition until the end of your turn. While you are Blinded in this way, your Speed is halved.
results.4-4: A sudden drop catches you by surprise. Make a [[/save dex dc=10]] saving throw to navigate the impediment. On a failed save, you fall 10 feet.
results.5-5: Your path takes you near a patch of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.lVkdQivhFHqVmxg7#razorvine]{Razorvine}. Make a [[/save dex dc=15]] saving throw or use 10 feet of movement (your choice) to avoid the razorvine. On a failed save, you take [[/damage 1d10 type=slashing]] damage.
results.6-6: A creature native to the area notices you. (The DM chooses a creature appropriate for the terrain.) Make a [[/save wis dc=10]] or [[/save cha dc=10]] saving throw (your choice). On a failed save, the creature joins the chase, with you as its quarry.
